channel.title: [Class Suggestion] Return of the Noble
channel.description:
Noble was removed because of a Hearsay that did not work as intented and because people thought Noble was too primarily focussed on vote manipulation.
My suggestion is to have him return with his old (but slightly nerfed) Spy Maid ability instead of 1 vote manipulation ability.
# [color=steblue] Noble [/color] (Social class)
**Passive**
* Royal Blood * Inquiries: When found dead in the morning, increase the trial limit for that day by one.
**Daytime abilities:** * Political Pressure: Force a player to accuse someone. You cannot force the King to accuse someone or force a player to accuse the King. (3 uses) * Spy Maid: Choose a player. You will see all whispers from and to that player today. Can target the King. Cannot be used before day 3. (3 uses)
**Nighttime abilities** * Royal Decree: Protect another player from being accused next day. Cannot target the King (3 uses) * Send Order: Target player cannot accuse or vote next day. Cannot target the King. (3 uses)
# [color=purple] Aristocrat (Unseen) [/color] (Social class)
**Passive** * Royal Blood
**Daytime abilities:** * Political Pressure: Force a player to accuse someone. You cannot force the King to accuse someone or force a player to accuse the King. (3 uses) * Spy Maid: Choose a player. You will see all whispers from and to that player today. Can target the King. Cannot be used before day 3. (3 uses)
**Nighttime abilities** * Royal Decree: Protect another player from being accused next day. Cannot target the King (3 uses) * Send Order: Target player cannot accuse or vote next day. Cannot target the King. (3 uses)

item.title: [Class Suggestion] Return of the Noble
item.dc:creator: Ulkesh
item.description:
@grahfite
I completely forgot the Royal Blood passive! Of course that should stay. Added it.

I think being able to use Spy Maid D2 is very strong. It both gives you some vital info on other BD and gives you an opportunity to declare Noble all with 1 ability.

D3 increases the chance that Noble is converted (either Aristocrat who also has Spy Maid, or Apostle who has Eavesdrop), so him breaking in a BD chat still gives you the info, but the Noble will be trusted a little less by those BD.
I wouldn’t be opposed removing this restriction though and see how that goes. (the fewer restrictions = the more clear the rules = the better the game)

@NuclearBurrito
No, that would be too much of a nerf. King should be in the dark too. Just requires a bit more thought from King when whisping.
